intro: Pseudechinolaena camusiana, commonly known as the Camus' spikeweed, is a member of the Poaceae family, characterized by its grass-like morphology. It is a perennial plant that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, often found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny florets. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions, with deep root systems that help it survive in nutrient-poor environments. Due to its resilience, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
